summary: Homeland Security component agencies collect information on noncitizen family members who are apprehended together at the southwest border. Each component collects the information it needs, but does not always consider the information needed by other DHS components. Without identifying and sharing this information, DHS risks removing individuals from the country who may be eligible for relief or protection based on their family relationships. We made...
title: Southwest Border: Actions Needed to Address Fragmentation in DHS's Processes for Apprehended Family Members
